references.reason: This paper introduces the framework of performative prediction, which is the foundation of this paper's theoretical contributions.
This paper provides essential theoretical tools for analyzing the convergence properties of the algorithm proposed in this paper.
This paper provides a foundational model for the numerical experiments on networked Cournot games.

references.paper_title: Multiplayer performative prediction: Learning in decision-dependent games
references.reason: This paper is closely related to the current work as it studies performative behavior in games, although the model and settings differ.

references.paper_title: Network effects in performative prediction games
references.reason: This paper is closely related to the current work as it studies performative behavior in games, offering valuable insights into the intricacies of decentralized settings.
